definitions.definition: To put shoes on one's own feet .
examples: Men and women clothed and shod for the ascent.

definitions.definition: To put shoes on someone or something else 's feet , especially to put horseshoes on a horse .
To cover an object with a protective layer of material .
examples: The billiard cue stick was shod in silver.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To put shoes on one's own feet .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To put shoes on someone or something else 's feet , especially to put horseshoes on a horse .
( intransitive , chiefly as past participle ) To cover an object with a protective layer of material .
